FuncDef: The display cpu-defend dynamic-adjust history-record command displays historical adaptive CPCAR adjustment records of protocol packets. The display cpu-defend dynamic-adjust history-record command displays historical adaptive CPCAR adjustment records of protocol packets.
CLIs: display cpu-defend dynamic-adjust history-record [ packet-type { arp-reply | arp-request | arp-request-uc | dhcp-request | dhcp-reply | nd } ] { all | slot <slot-id> }
display cpu-defend dynamic-adjust history-record [ packet-type { arp-reply | arp-request | arp-request-uc | dhcp-request | dhcp-reply } ] { all | slot <slot-id> }
display cpu-defend dynamic-adjust history-record [ packet-type { arp-reply | arp-request | arp-request-uc | dhcp-discovery | dhcp-request | dhcp-reply | nd } ] { all | slot <slot-id> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the broadcast packets sent by DHCP clients.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.
-

Specifies the packets sent by DHCP servers.
-

Specifies the packets sent by DHCP clients.
-

Specifies IPv6 neighbor discovery packets.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

Specifies the slot ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters without spaces.
